meanings.definition: A large seabird with a white body and black-tipped wings.
meanings.sent1: The gannet soared gracefully over the ocean, its white body shining in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a gannet diving into the water to catch fish for its meal.
meanings.sent3: The gannet tried to wear a tuxedo to fit in with the penguins, causing much amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her spirit was as free as a gannet, soaring high above all worries.
meanings.sent5: The gannet's wingspan was so wide, it looked like a white cloud in the sky.

meanings.sent1: He ate like a gannet at the buffet, piling his plate high with food.
meanings.sent2: The raccoon in our backyard is a real gannet, always raiding the trash cans.
meanings.sent3: The gannet at the party finished all the snacks in record time, leaving everyone surprised.
meanings.sent4: Her appetite was a gannet's, never satisfied with just one serving.
meanings.sent5: The child was a little gannet, gobbling up cookies as if they were going out of style.
